onboarding.welcome_title: Welcome to TilesWM – Your New Window Manager
onboarding.welcome_subtitle: In this quick tour, we'll show you how to set up and use TilesWM.
onboarding.language_picker_subtitle: You can change this anytime in Settings
onboarding.settings_hint: Tap Settings ▸ General to reopen the onboarding whenever you want.

accessibility.help: TilesWM relies on Accessibility to manage and arrange your windows seamlessly.

autostart.unavailable: Not available on this macOS version
autostart.help: TilesWM will launch automatically when you log in, so your tiling system is ready instantly.

notifications.help: Notifications let you know when you switch profiles, so you always know which layout is active.

quick_step.step1_detail: Grant the required permissions to enable TilesWM's key features.
quick_step.step2_detail: Learn the basics. A step-by-step guide will walk you through every part—just follow the highlights.
quick_step.learn2: • Edit the profile you just created
quick_step.learn3: • Draw and customize tiles to fit your workflow
quick_step.drag_prefix: Just move this window — the tile overlay appears automatically in
quick_step.drag_suffix: while moving this window — release it over a highlighted tile to snap it into place.
quick_step.drag_always_active: Just move this window — the tile overlay appears automatically in Always Active Mode.
quick_step.hold_and_drag: Hold {0} while moving this window — release it over a highlighted tile to snap it into place.

completion.title: You're all set. Now make it yours.
completion.subtitle: Thanks for adding TilesWM to your setup. Now that you've completed the onboarding, you can create advanced profiles, customize settings, and use all the features—so you get the most out of TilesWM.
completion.help_suffix: for tutorials, FAQs, and expert support.
completion.feedback_suffix: to share ideas, connect with the community, and hear directly from the developer.
completion.footnote: You can access these resources anytime from the TilesWM menu → About This App.

keyboard_shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
keyboard_shortcuts.previous_profile_desc: Set a keyboard shortcut to switch to the previous compatible profile.
keyboard_shortcuts.next_profile_desc: Set a keyboard shortcut to switch to the next compatible profile.
keyboard_shortcuts.validation_modifiers: Shortcuts must include at least one modifier key (⌘, ⌥, ⌃, ⇧)
keyboard_shortcuts.validation_reserved: This shortcut is reserved by the system

reset_general.title: Reset General Settings
reset_general.message: This will reset all general settings (language, utility key, shortcuts, accent color, and opacity values) back to their default values. Your profiles will not be affected.
reset_general.countdown: Confirm button will be enabled in {0} seconds
reset_general.ready: You can now confirm the action.

reset_profiles.title: Reset All Profile Data
reset_profiles.message: This action will permanently delete all your profile data. This can't be undone!
reset_profiles.countdown: Confirm button will be enabled in {0} seconds
reset_profiles.ready: You can now confirm the action.

wipe_database.title: Wipe Database
wipe_database.message:
This will delete settings, profiles, and debug logs, then rebuild the database with default values. Make sure you have a backup before continuing.

Note: Accessibility permissions can't be revoked programmatically.
wipe_database.countdown: Wipe will be available in {0} seconds
wipe_database.ready: Database wipe can now be confirmed.

profile_compatibility.arrangement_mismatch: At least one display's position or arrangement differs

auto_mapping.title: Quick Profile from Current Layout
auto_mapping.description: TilesWM will scan all open windows on this display and automatically generate a profile that arranges them exactly as they are now. Perfect when you've manually set up a layout you love!
auto_mapping.note: Note: The generated profile will use rectangular approximations to match your window positions; fine-tune tiles in the editor if needed.
